clinical_study.brief_title: Ayurvedic Nutritional Counseling for Patients With IBS in Comparison to Conventional Nutritional Counseling
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Controlled Pilot Study on Ayurvedic Nutritional Counseling for Patients With Irritable Bowel Syndrome in Comparison to Conventional Nutritional Counseling

brief_summary.textblock: The main goal of this randomized, controlled clinical pilot study is to evaluate the efficacy of an individual Ayurvedic nutritional counseling (according to tradition) compared to an individual conventional dietary advice (according to the German Nutrition Society - DGE) in patients with irritable bowel syndrome. It is to be investigated whether nutritional therapy elements, which patients can self-implement independently in the home environment, can achieve sustainable therapy effects.

primary_outcome.measure: Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scoring System (IBS-SSS) - Change
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from IBS-SSS Baseline at 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from CPSS Baseline at 4 weeks, 12 weeks and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D) - Change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from HADS-D Baseline at 4 weeks, 12 weeks and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Irritable bowel Syndrome - Quality of life (IBS-QOL) - Change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from IBS-QOL Baseline at 4 weeks, 12 weeks and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: VAS: Pain, Sleep, General bothersomeness, Expectation - Change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from VAS Baseline at 4 weeks, 12 weeks and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scoring System (IBS-SSS) - Change
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from IBS-SSS Baseline at 4 weeks and 6 months

other_outcome.measure: Stool analysis: Intestinal microbiome by sequencing 16S rRNA

arm_group.description: Patients will receive three Ayurvedic nutritional counselings (according to tradition) after 1, 3 and 8 weeks after Baseline.
Patients will receive three conventional nutritional counselings (according to German Nutrition Society - DGE) after 1, 3 and 8 weeks after Baseline.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis "irritable bowel syndrome" according to the ROM-III criteria and the German S3 guideline (Layer 2011)
- Female and male patients between 18 and 70 years of age
- Declaration of consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bad general condition
- Serious acute or chronic comorbidity
- Pregnancy and breast feeding period
- Eating disorder
- In recognition procedures for early retirement or disability
- Simultaneous participation in another clinical trial
- Participation in a clinical trial within the last 3 months before enrollment
